t: Jeremiah 13
The Ruined Waistband
Thus*p the Lord*s said to me, “Go and buy yourself a linen waistband and put it around your waist, but do not put it in water.”
So I bought the waistband in accordance with the word of the Lord*s and put it around my waist.
Then the word of the Lord*s came to me a second time, saying,
“Take the waistband that you have bought, which is around your waist, and arise, go to the Euphrates and hide it there in a crevice of the rock.”
So I went and hid it by the Euphrates, as the Lord*s had commanded me.
After many days the Lord*s said to me, “Arise, go to the Euphrates and take from there the waistband which I commanded you to hide there.”
Then I went to the Euphrates and dug, and I took the waistband from the place where I had hidden it; and lo, the waistband was ruined, it was totally worthless.
Then*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Thus says the Lord,*s ‘Just so will I destroy the pride of Judah and the great pride of Jerusalem.

This wicked people, who refuse to listen to My words, who walk in the stubbornness of their hearts and have gone after other gods to serve them and to bow down to them, let them be just like this waistband which is totally worthless.

For as the waistband clings to the waist of a man, so I made the whole household of Israel and the whole household of Judah cling to Me,’ declares the Lord,*s ‘that they might be for Me a people, for renown, for praise and for glory; but they did not listen.’
Captivity Threatened

“Therefore*p you are to speak this word to them, ‘Thus says the Lord,*s the God of Israel, “Every jug is to be filled with wine.” ’ And when they say to you, ‘Do we not very well know that every jug is to be filled with wine?’

then say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord,*s “Behold I am about to fill all the inhabitants of this land—the kings that sit for David on his throne, the priests, the prophets and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem—with drunkenness!
I will dash them against each other, both the fathers and the sons together,” declares the Lord.*s “I will not show pity nor be sorry nor have compassion so as not to destroy them.” ’ ”
Listen*pn and give heed, do not be haughty, For*ln the Lord*s has spoken.

Give*ln glory to the Lord*s your God, Before*ln He brings darkness And*ln before your feet stumble On*ln the dusky mountains, And*ln while you are hoping for light He*ln makes it into deep darkness, And*iln turns it*i into gloom.

But*ln if you will not listen to it, My*ln soul will sob in secret for such*i pride; And*ln my eyes will bitterly weep And*ln flow down with tears, Because*ln the flock of the Lord*s has been taken captive.
Say*ln to the king and the queen mother, “Take*ln a lowly seat, For*ln your beautiful crown Has*ln come down from your head.”
The*ln cities of the Negev have been locked up, And*ln there is no one to open them;*i All*ln Judah has been carried into exile, Wholly*ln carried into exile.
“Lift*ln up your eyes and see Those*ln coming from the north. Where*ln is the flock that was given you, Your*ln beautiful sheep?
What*ln will you say when He appoints over you— And*ln you yourself had taught them— Former*ln companions to be head over you? Will*ln not pangs take hold of you Like*ln a woman in childbirth?
If*ln you say in your heart, ‘Why*ln have these things happened to me?’ Because*ln of the magnitude of your iniquity Your*ln skirts have been removed And*ln your heels have been exposed.
Can*ln the Ethiopian change his skin Or*ln the leopard his spots? Then*iln you also can do good Who*ln are accustomed to doing evil.
Therefore*ln I will scatter them like drifting straw To*ln the desert wind.
This*ln is your lot, the portion measured to you From*ln Me,” declares the Lord,*s “Because*ln you have forgotten Me And*ln trusted in falsehood.
So*ln I Myself have also stripped your skirts off over your face, That*ln your shame may be seen.

As*ln for your adulteries and your lustful*i neighings, The*ln lewdness of your prostitution On*ln the hills in the field, I*ln have seen your abominations. Woe*ln to you, O Jerusalem! How*ln long will you remain unclean?”
